intro: Dianthus seguieri var. collinus, commonly known as the alpine campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters, featuring dense clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate, often covered in fine hairs, and stems that are usually hairy as well. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Its hardy nature and attractive blooms make it a valuable addition to gardens in cooler climates.
